content: Although I've always been very conservative about using energy around my house to save money, I see this as nothing more than another meaningless gesture designed to bring attention to the man-made climate change hoax. Mother Nature is not influenced by turning off your lights for an hour. Energy is expensive, and is only going to become more unaffordable under Obama's cap and trade scheme. This might be a good exercise in preparing yourselves not to have power for lights, heat, air-conditioning, TV, etc., but it's only a feel-good gesture at best. "The World's Finest"

content: I highly recommend that Republicans take this Earth Hour thing seriously. It's a chance for you all to get a taste of what some people have to endure all day, every day - not just when it's convenient. Because of YOUR failed economic policies, this is now the current reality for people that some of you have the nerve to believe "aren't supposed to be on welfare." If you guys want to impress someone, turn off your gas, water, and electric for an entire week. Yes, some people in the major urban centers are just that desperate. They aren't looking for a hand-out. They are looking for a hand; or just a way out. Since most of you don't care, what I want to know is if you're unwilling to save one life, how do you presume to participate in "Saving the Planet?"

content: Although I've always been very conservative about using energy around my house to save money, I see this as nothing more than another meaningless gesture designed to bring attention to the man-made climate change hoax. Mother Nature is not influenced by turning off your lights for an hour. Energy is expensive, and is only going to become more unaffordable under Obama's cap and trade scheme. This might be a good exercise in preparing yourselves not to have power for lights, heat, air-conditioning, TV, etc., but it's only a feel-good gesture at best. "The World's Finest"
